intro: Ferula pseudalliacea, commonly known as the Persian cow's milk plant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer, and its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine. Ferula pseudalliacea is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features such as deep root systems and reduced leaf surface area.
